By utilizing a transformer-based design, HypHGT effectively captures both local and global dependencies across diverse node types, addressing limitations of traditional methods that rely on tangent-space operations. The proposed relation-specific hyperbolic attention mechanism enables efficient learning with reduced training time and memory usage, demonstrating superior performance in node classification tasks.

summary: The paper introduces T3 (Testing Trustworthy Thinking), a benchmark to rigorously evaluate LLM causal reasoning across Pearl’s Ladder of Causality. Using T3, the authors diagnose structural failures and validate a process-verified protocol, highlighting the distinction between sycophancy and cautious refusal.

title: Exact string

authors: ['Qirui Chen', 'Jingxian Shuai', 'Shuangwu Chen', 'Shenghao Ye', 'Zijian Wen', 'Xufei Su', 'Jie Jin3', 'Jiangming Li', 'Jun Chen', 'Xiaobin Tan', 'Jian Yang']
summary: This paper introduces HardSecBench, a benchmark evaluating security awareness in LLM-generated hardware code. It assesses functional correctness alongside security risks such as DMA write bypass vulnerabilities, highlighting challenges in LLM-assisted hardware development.

title: LifeAgentBench: A Multi-dimensional Benchmark and Agent for Personal Health Assistants in Digital Health
summary: The paper introduces LifeAgentBench, a large-scale benchmark for evaluating long-horizon, cross-dimensional lifestyle health reasoning. It provides a standardized evaluation protocol and benchmarks to advance the development of AI-driven health assistants.

filename: 2601.13885v1_Confident Rankings with Fewer Items Adaptive LLM E.pdf

summary: This paper introduces a method extending IRT-based adaptive testing to continuous bounded scores using a heteroskedastic normal distribution. It achieves reliable ranking with fewer items and lower cost, improving ranking correlation over random sampling.

title: Human Simulation Computation: A Human-Inspired Framework for Adaptive AI Systems
summary: The paper introduces Human Simulation Computation (HSC), a framework that models intelligence through a continuous loop of thinking, action, learning, reflection, and scheduling. It emphasizes human-like reasoning strategies and action-based adaptation, arguing that robust AI requires integrating environmental feedback and real-world interaction beyond static language training.

title: RL-BioAug: Label-Efficient Reinforcement Learning
summary: The paper introduces RL-BioAug, a label-efficient reinforcement learning framework that autonomously optimizes data augmentation policies for EEG tasks, achieving significant performance gains over random strategies.

title: Autonomous Knowledge Graph Exploration
authors: ['Joaquín Polonuer', 'Lucas Vittor', 'Iñaki Arango', 'Ayush Noori', 'David A. Clifton', 'Luciano Del Corro', 'Marinka Zitnik', 'David A. summary: The paper introduces ARK: ADAPTIVE BREADTH-DEPTH RETRIEVER, an intelligent knowledge graph retriever that balances breadth and depth to improve language model performance. ARK uses a two-operation toolset combining global lexical search and neighborhood exploration to achieve robust multi-hop traversal without relying on fragile seeds or fixed depths. It demonstrates significant improvements over retrieval-based and agentic methods, achieving high average Hit@1 and MRR across multiple benchmarks.

title: Collective Intelligence in Science
summary: The paper presents a novel mechanism leveraging a self-resolving prediction market integrated with a chat interface to enable experts to collaboratively analyze complex scientific hypotheses.
